item.title: Massive healthcare breaches prompt US cybersecurity rules overhaul
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has proposed updates to the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) to secure patients' health data following a surge in massive healthcare data leaks. [...]

item.title: US Treasury Department breached through remote support platform
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Chinese state-sponsored threat actors hacked the U.S. Treasury Department after breaching a remote support platform used by the federal agency. [...]

item.title: Hackers exploit Four-Faith router flaw to open reverse shells
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors are exploiting a post-authentication remote command injection vulnerability in Four-Faith routers tracked as CVE-2024-12856 to open reverse shells back to the attackers. [...]

item.title: Microsoft issues urgent dev warning to update .NET installer link
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft is forcing .NET developers to quickly update their apps and developer pipelines so they do not use 'azureedge.net' domains to install .NET components, as the domain will soon be unavailable due to the bankruptcy and imminent shutdown of CDN provider Edgio. [...]

item.title: AT&T and Verizon say networks secure after Salt Typhoon breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: AT&T and Verizon confirmed they were breached in a massive Chinese espionage campaign targeting telecom carriers worldwide but said the hackers have now been evicted from their networks. [...]

item.title: Malware botnets exploit outdated D-Link routers in recent attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two botnets tracked as 'Ficora' and 'Capsaicin' have recorded increased activity in targeting D-Link routers that have reached end of life or are running outdated firmware versions. [...]

item.title: Hackers steal ZAGG customers' credit cards in third-party breach
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: ZAGG Inc. is informing customers that their credit card data has been exposed to unauthorized individuals after hackers compromised a third-party application provided by the company's e-commerce provider, BigCommerce. [...]

item.title: Customer data from 800,000 electric cars and owners exposed online
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: Volkswagen's automotive software company, Cariad, exposed data collected from around 800,000 electric cars. The info could be linked to drivers' names and reveal precise vehicle locations. [...]

item.title: White House links ninth telecom breach to Chinese hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A White House official has added a ninth U.S. telecommunications company to the list of telecoms breached in a Chinese hacking campaign that impacted dozens of countries. [...]

item.title: Hackers exploit DoS flaw to disable Palo Alto Networks firewalls
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Palo Alto Networks is warning that hackers are exploiting the CVE-2024-3393 denial of service vulnerability to disable firewall protections by forcing it to reboot. [...]

item.title: Cybersecurity firm's Chrome extension hijacked to steal users' data
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: At least five Chrome extensions were compromised in a coordinated attack where a threat actor injected code that steals sensitive information from users. [...]
